oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The National Barn Dance - 1948-02-14 - Part 4
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WLS National Barn Dance radio show, originally broadcast February 14, 1948, part 4. Featuring announcer Hal O'Halloran (unconfirmed), and performers Red Blanchard, Grace Wilson, Karl & Harty, the Klein Brothers (Ray and Augie), Blenda Blimp, Little Genevieve (Ted Morse), Stinky James, Nancy Hurt, Cousin Tilford, Dolph Hewitt, the DeZurik Sisters, the Sage Riders (possibly including Don White, Ray Klein, Red Blanchard, and Dolph Hewitt), Jimmy James, the Maple City Four, Rex Allen, and Doc Hopkins (unconfirmed).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jimmy James; Maple City Four; Rex Allen; Doc Hopkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Hal O'Halloran introduces Jimmy James -- Who (Jimmy James banjo) -- Hal O'Halloran introduces 'Angus Dunk' -- Bill Grogan's Goat (Maple City Four) -- Hal O'Halloran introduces Rex Allen -- Beautiful Dreamer (Rex Allen) -- Hal O'Halloran introduces Doc -- Boil Them Cabbage Down (Doc Hopkins [unconfirmed], cast) -- You Go To Your Church (Maple City Four) -- Hal O'Halloran introduces the national anthem
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WLS (Radio station : Chicago, Ill.); National Barn Dance (Radio program); Blanchard, Donald Red; Wilson, Grace; Karl and Harty; Davis, Karl, 1905-1979; Taylor, Hartford C., 1905-1963; DeZurik Sisters (Musical group); DeZurik, Carolyn; DeZurik, Lorraine; Klein Brothers (Musical group); Klein, Augie; Klein, Ray; Morse, Ted; Hewitt, Dolph; Sage Riders (Musical group); Maple City Four (Musical group); Arkie the Arkansas Woodchopper; James, Jimmy, 1912-
